sourceText: Teens especially need to be able to communicate with their friends.
text: Teens especially need to be able to communicate with their friends.

sourceText: Help your teen connect through social media and other safe distancing ways.
text: Help your teen connect through social media and other safe distancing ways.

sourceText: This is something you can do together, too!
text: This is something you can do together, too!

sourceText: Use positive words when telling your child what to do; like “Please put your clothes away” (instead of “Don’t make a mess”).
text: Use positive words when telling your child what to do; like “Please put your clothes away” (instead of “Don’t make a mess”).

sourceText: Say the behaviour you want to see.
text: Say the behaviour you want to see.

sourceText: Help your teen stay connected.
text: Help your teen stay connected.

sourceText: Praise your child when they are behaving well.
text: Praise your child when they are behaving well.

sourceText: Keeping It Positive
text: Keeping It Positive

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Covid-19 Parenting

sourceText: It‘s hard to feel positive when our kids or teenagers are driving us crazy. We often end up saying “Stop doing that!”
text: It‘s hard to feel positive when our kids or teenagers are driving us crazy. We often end up saying “Stop doing that!”

sourceText: But children are much more likely to do what we ask if we give them positive instructions and lots of praise for what they do right.
text: But children are much more likely to do what we ask if we give them positive instructions and lots of praise for what they do right.

sourceText: Shouting at your child will just make you and them more stressed and angrier. Get your child’s attention by using their name. Speak in a calm voice.
text: Shouting at your child will just make you and them more stressed and angrier. Get your child’s attention by using their name. Speak in a calm voice.

sourceText: It’s all in the delivery.
text: It’s all in the delivery.

sourceText: Try praising your child or teenager for something they have done well.
text: Try praising your child or teenager for something they have done well.

sourceText: They may not show it, but you’ll see them doing that good thing again.
text: They may not show it, but you’ll see them doing that good thing again.

sourceText: It will also reassure them that you notice and care.
text: It will also reassure them that you notice and care.

sourceText: Can your child actually do what you are asking them?
text: Can your child actually do what you are asking them?

sourceText: It is very hard for a child to keep quiet inside for a whole day but maybe they can keep quiet for 15 minutes while you are on a call.
text: It is very hard for a child to keep quiet inside for a whole day but maybe they can keep quiet for 15 minutes while you are on a call.

sourceText: Get real.
text: Get real.
